bibl.title: Military Orders for Valery Havard, James F. Presnell, Albert E. Truby, August 2, 1900

div1.p: Special Orders #126 sends Havard to Guanajay and Presnell and Truby to accompany the 1st Infantry on transport “Rawlins” to the United States. Included is a note written by Truby. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Valery Havard, James F. Presnell, Albert E. Truby, August 2, 1900
div1.p:
Dunshie's order must
have been revoked as
he remained at Guanajay
AET

[unclear]
OFFICE
JAN 15 190[unclear]
ROLLS DIVISION.

ORDERS, BOOKS, BLANKS & D.C. DIV.
A. G. O.
RECD. SEP 15 1900
Havard - Presnell - Truby

FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Vol 175 A 1900

SPECIAL ORDERS, }
No. 126. }

HEADQUARTERS DIVISION OF CUBA,
Havana, August 2, 1900.

1. Leave of absence for two (2) months, with permission
to apply to the Adjutant General of the Army for an ex-
tension of one (1) month and to go beyond the limits of
the Division, is hereby granted to Captain Lloyd S. McCor-
mick, Quartermaster, 7th Cavalry.

2. Paragraph 1, Special Orders No. 123, current series,
these Headquarters, granting leave of absence to Acting
Assistant Surgeon Wylie H. Forsythe, U. S. Army, is
amended so as to report to the commanding officer of the
battalion of the 1st Infantry going on the transport Raw-
lins to accompany that battalion to the United States, and
as soon thereafter as his services can be spared to avail
himself of the leave granted him.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

3. The verbal instructions of the Division Commander
directing Major Valery Havard, Medical Department, U. S.
Army, Chief Surgeon of the Division, on July 31, 1900, to
proceed to Guanajay, Cuba, and make an inspection of the
sanitary condition of the post at that point, with special
reference to the transfer of the troops to the United States,
and upon completion thereof to return to his proper station,
Havana, Cuba, are confirmed and made of record as having
been necessary for the public service.

4. Leave of absence for two (2) months, with permission
to go beyond the limits of the Division, is hereby granted
Post Chaplain S. W. Bell, U. S. Army.

5. The following named medical officers and enlisted
men of the Hospital Corps, U. S. Army, will accompany
the 1st Infantry to the United States on the Government
transport Rawlins:
With battalion from Pinar del Rio:
Acting Assistant Surgeon J. F. Presnell, U. S. Army;
Acting Assistant Surgeon A. A. Nouel, U. S. Army;
Acting Hospital Steward E. P. Hammond;
Acting Hospital Steward C. G. Sturtevant, and twelve
(12) privates of the Hospital Corps, U. S. Army.
With battalion from Guanajay:

1st Lieutenant A. E. Truby, Medical Department, U. S.
Army;
Acting Assistant Surgeon J. F. Dunshie, U. S. Army;

Hospital Steward J. Dykstra, and six (6) privates of
the Hospital Corps, U. S. Army.

Upon arrival in the United States and when their services
are no longer required, the medical officers and enlisted
men will report to the Adjutant General of the Army for
further orders.
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:

H. L. SCOTT,
Assistant Adjutant General.
